title: CVE-2020-3452, unauthenticated file read in Cisco ASA & Cisco Firepower.
content:
Summary:
#The affected IP:
█████
Here is POC of CVE-2020-3452, unauthenticated file read in Cisco ASA & Cisco Firepower.
For example to read "/+CSCOE+/portal_inc.lua" file.
for example:
████/+CSCOT+/translation-table?type=mst&textdomain=/%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua&default-language&lang=../
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Cisco has released the fix https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-ro-path-KJuQhB86
Impact
This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform directory traversal attacks and read sensitive files on the system.
steps: Send a crafted HTTP request to the vulnerable Cisco ASA or Firepower device with a directory traversal payload in the URL.
The crafted URL should include the path traversal sequence to access sensitive files, such as '/+CSCOT+/translation-table?type=mst&textdomain=/%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua&default-language&lang=../'.
vuln_description: This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform directory traversal attacks and read sensitive files on the system by exploiting a flaw in the web services interface of Cisco ASA and Firepower devices.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward directory traversal technique that does not require multiple components, complex state manipulation, or novel logic. The vulnerability is triggered by a single crafted HTTP request, making it relatively easy to discover and exploit.
